summary:
Physician and researcher effectively combining research, policy development and innovation activities in order to change health care, the organization of health services, health systems and health policy in ways that improve the health level and well-being of populations in an equitable way. 

Areas of expertise include (among others):
o Health systems and policies, in particular international comparative analysis of health systems
o Transformation of systems (health, research and innovation (R&I), food, and education)
o Public health genomics, personalised medicine, personalised nutrition and personalised health care

Experience in Turkey, the Netherlands and Europe.

As a public health physician, a researcher at VU Amsterdam University, and mother of three children, has been leading an advocacy campaign to open schools in Turkey during the pandemic (member of Turkish Medical Association's Working Group on School Health and Pandemic Working Group)

profile_positions.description:
Developing and leading the ‘Let’s open the schools’ initiative in Turkey, www.okullariacalim.org  and serving as a member of Turkish Medical Association’s Working Group on School Health (Feb. 2021 onwards)
▪	Development and execution of an advocacy project to mobilize stakeholders towards ending the school closures due to the pandemic in Turkey
▫	Carry out root cause and stakeholder analyses to understand the underlying reasons of school closures and draw a plan to mobilize stakeholders
▫	Publication of a milestone report on how and why the schools must be opened in Turkey: ‘Education During Pandemic in Turkey’ (Dec 2020, updated Jan 2021)
▫	Writing various other reports, analyses, position papers, info notes, etc. for public and various stakeholders in Turkey, including Turkish Medical Association, teachers’ unions, minister of education, experts, and others. 
▪	Analysis of scientific and policy developments on COVID-19, schools and children around the globe on various facets such as vaccination of youth and children, case and transmission patterns, policies of different countries on vaccination and schooling, etc.; considering the underlying country context (including population structure, income level, education level, policy values, and many other factors), as well as health and education systems and policies, to derive lessons and develop concrete recommendations for opening schools in Turkey.
▪	Public campaign via social media and conventional media, as well as being the ‘public face’ of the campaign
